definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: They deflated the tires slightly to allow the truck to drive under the overpass.
sentences.chinese: 他們稍微放掉車胎的氣以讓卡車在跨線橋下行駛。

sentences.english: The inflator can be conveniently disassembled for air inflation of tyres.
sentences.chinese: 氣筒可方便卸下用於車胎等充氣。

sentences.english: You can pump up the tyres by hand or with this special machine.
sentences.chinese: 這可以用手或用這個特殊的機器給車胎打氣。

sentences.english: You have let all the air out of the tyres.
sentences.chinese: 你讓車胎的氣都跑光了。

sentences.english: Have a spare tube and tools, and know how to change a tire.
sentences.chinese: 攜帶備用車胎和工具，並知道如何換胎。

sentences.english: Be careful. One of your tyres is down.
sentences.chinese: 小心，你的車胎有一隻快沒氣了。

sentences.english: A few days later he announced the tyres had been snatched.
sentences.chinese: 沒過幾天，他又宣稱車胎被人取走。

sentences.english: Could you please inflate my tires?
sentences.chinese: 請給我的車胎打點氣好嗎？

sentences.english: Take the tyre off the wheel.
sentences.chinese: 把車胎從車輪上拆下來。

sentences.english: Had a puncture and for the last hour had to push the bicycle.
sentences.chinese: 他的車胎放了炮，最後一小時只能推着自行車走。

sentences.english: A nail on the road punctured the tyre.
sentences.chinese: 路上的釘子把車胎戳穿了。

sentences.english: Would you please check the tyre pressure?
sentences.chinese: 請檢查一下車胎壓好嗎？

sentences.english: I put too much air into the bicycle tyre and it burst.
sentences.chinese: 我把自行車輪胎打氣打得太足了，所以車胎爆破了。

sentences.english: Children play on a swing made with a used tyre, Tongxin County, Ningxia, China.
sentences.chinese: 在寧夏同心縣，孩子們在用車胎自制的鞦韆下活動。

sentences.english: When Dick saw a woman with a flat tire, he offered to give her a hand with it.
sentences.chinese: 迪克看到一個婦女的車胎爆了，就主動爲她幫忙換胎。

sentences.english: We're late because one of our tires bles out.
sentences.chinese: 我們遲到是因爲一個車胎爆了。

definition: to abrade/to scrape/to chafe/to graze/abrasion/friction burn/scratch
to cause damage to/to ruin/to destroy
